Package io.github.bfox1.command

Interface ICommand

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Command
    public interface ICommand
    ICommand is to contain methods for creating a Command Class. This Interface should NOT be interfaced with. Please use Command for extending. Interfacing with ICommand will NOT work when Command gets executed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      IActionResult<java.lang.String> execute​(IEvent event, java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> args)
      Execute gets called when the command has been processed.
      java.lang.String getDescription()
      Returns the description of the Command.

      Simple Method to return Module Name.

      Returns the name of the command given.
      java.lang.String getPermissionNode()
      The node string for permissions.
      java.lang.String helpSyntax()  
      void init()
      Initializes the Command.
      boolean isDiscordChatEnabled()
      To check if the Command should fire in Discord Chat.
      boolean isDiscordPMEnabled()
      To Check if the Command should fire in Discord PM.
      boolean isOtherEnabled()
      To Check if the Command should fire separately in another Messaging Avenue.
      boolean isTwitchChatEnabled()
      To check if the Command should fire in Twitch Chat.
      boolean isTwitchDMEnabled()
      To check if the Command should fire in Twitch DM.
      void setModuleName​(java.lang.String s)
      Assigns the name of the Command with the name of the Module.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the command given.
        Returns:
        commandName

      • setModuleName

        void setModuleName​(java.lang.String s)
        Assigns the name of the Command with the name of the Module. This will be set automatically based on the name provided in the Module class.
        Parameters:
        s - The name of the Module.

      • getModuleName

        java.lang.String getModuleName()
        Simple Method to return Module Name. All commands need a Module Name. Without one, Command will not be loaded.
        Returns:
        The Module Name.

      • getPermissionNode

        java.lang.String getPermissionNode()
        The node string for permissions.
        Returns:
        The Permission node.

      • isTwitchChatEnabled

        boolean isTwitchChatEnabled()
        To check if the Command should fire in Twitch Chat.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • isTwitchDMEnabled

        boolean isTwitchDMEnabled()
        To check if the Command should fire in Twitch DM.
        Returns:
        Boolean

      • isDiscordChatEnabled

        boolean isDiscordChatEnabled()
        To check if the Command should fire in Discord Chat.
        Returns:
        Boolean

      • isDiscordPMEnabled

        boolean isDiscordPMEnabled()
        To Check if the Command should fire in Discord PM.
        Returns:
        Boolean

      • isOtherEnabled

        boolean isOtherEnabled()
        To Check if the Command should fire separately in another Messaging Avenue. This will require the Command to have special checks to verify the source the Command came from.
        Returns:
        Boolean

      • init

        void init()
        Initializes the Command.

      • execute

        IActionResult<java.lang.String> execute​(IEvent event,
                                        java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> args)
        Execute gets called when the command has been processed. This includes Twitch Chat, Twitch Dm, Discord Channel Chat and Discord PM
        Parameters:
        event - IEvent is a wrapper of all Chat Events. Please be sure to listen for the Right Chat Events as determine which one it is.
        args - The Arguments passed after the command was entered.
        Returns:
        The Action Result.

      • getDescription

        java.lang.String getDescription()
        Returns the description of the Command. Not required, but all commands should have one.
        Returns:
        The String description

      • helpSyntax

        java.lang.String helpSyntax()
